name: 李老师不是你老师

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
In recent years, the number of documents posted online on the China Judgment Documents Network has shown a sharp downward trend, which has attracted much attention. On December 22, the relevant person in charge of the Supreme People's Court stated that there has never been a "stop" from posting documents online. The aforementioned reduction in the disclosure rate is a "targeted rectification measure" and "optimization" of the Judgment Documents Network that is now open to the public, and it will continue to play its due role. 
The head of the department emphasized that "disclosure" and "publication" cannot be equated. Judicial openness does not mean that all judicial information must be published on the Internet. Judicial openness includes both online and offline disclosure, and includes both disclosure to the parties and disclosure to the public.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On December 23, in Gansu, a driver posted a video saying that he had delivered a truckload of materials worth RMB 620,000 to the disaster area for earthquake relief, but on his way back, his truck was detained in Linxia County on the grounds that return trucks could not be loaded with goods.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Coincidentally, on the 23rd, a truck driver who was delivering supplies to Qinghai also posted that he was allowed free passage when delivering supplies, but was charged tolls on the return trip.
